meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be a friend but actually is an enemy.
meanings.sent1: My frenemy acted nice to my face but talked badly about me behind my back.
meanings.sent2: I can never fully trust my frenemy because I know their true intentions.
meanings.sent3: At the party, my frenemy offered to help, but then spilled punch on my new shirt.
meanings.sent4: Dealing with a frenemy is like walking on eggshells, never knowing when they'll turn on you.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a frenemy is like a wolf in sheep's clothing, appearing friendly but ready to attack.

meanings.definition: A person who is both a friend and an enemy.
meanings.sent1: My frenemy always surprises me with both acts of kindness and betrayal.
meanings.sent2: It's confusing to have a frenemy because their actions can be unpredictable.
meanings.sent3: When my frenemy invited me out for coffee, I didn't know if it was to catch up or criticize me.
meanings.sent4: Having a frenemy is like having a double-edged sword in your life, bringing both joy and pain.
meanings.sent5: The relationship with my frenemy is a rollercoaster of emotions, never knowing what to expect next.
